verses.plain: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, eat that thou findest; eat this roll, and go speak unto the house of Israel.

tokens.t: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, eat that thou findest; eat this roll, and go speak unto the house of Israel.

verses.plain: So I opened my mouth, and he caused me to eat that roll.

tokens.t: So I opened my mouth, and he caused me to eat that roll.

verses.plain: And he said unto me, Son of man, cause thy belly to eat, and fill thy bowels with this roll that I give thee. Then did I eat it; and it was in my mouth as honey for sweetness.

tokens.t: And he said unto me, Son of man, cause thy belly to eat, and fill thy bowels with this roll that I give thee. Then did I eat
and it was in my mouth as honey for sweetness.

verses.plain: ¶ And he said unto me, Son of man, go, get thee unto the house of Israel, and speak with my words unto them.

tokens.t: ¶ And he said unto me, Son of man, go, get thee unto the house of Israel, and speak with my words unto them.

verses.plain: For thou art not sent to a people of a strange speech and of an hard language, but to the house of Israel;

tokens.t: For thou
not sent to a people of a strange speech and of an hard language,
to the house of Israel;

verses.plain: Not to many people of a strange speech and of an hard language, whose words thou canst not understand. Surely, had I sent thee to them, they would have hearkened unto thee.

tokens.t: Not to many people of a strange speech and of an hard language, whose words thou canst not understand. Surely, had I sent thee to them, they would have hearkened unto thee.

verses.plain: But the house of Israel will not hearken unto thee; for they will not hearken unto me: for all the house of Israel are impudent and hardhearted.

tokens.t: But the house of Israel will not hearken unto thee; for they will not hearken unto me: for all the house of Israel
impudent and hardhearted.

verses.plain: Behold, I have made thy face strong against their faces, and thy forehead strong against their foreheads.

tokens.t: Behold, I have made thy face strong against their faces, and thy forehead strong against their foreheads.

verses.plain: As an adamant harder than flint have I made thy forehead: fear them not, neither be dismayed at their looks, though they be a rebellious house.

tokens.t: As an adamant harder than flint have I made thy forehead: fear them not, neither be dismayed at their looks, though they
a rebellious house.

verses.plain: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, all my words that I shall speak unto thee receive in thine heart, and hear with thine ears.

tokens.t: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, all my words that I shall speak unto thee receive in thine heart, and hear with thine ears.

verses.plain: And go, get thee to them of the captivity, unto the children of thy people, and speak unto them, and tell them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear.

tokens.t: And go, get thee to them of the captivity, unto the children of thy people, and speak unto them, and tell them, Thus saith the Lord
; whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear.

verses.plain: Then the spirit took me up, and I heard behind me a voice of a great rushing, saying, Blessed be the glory of the LORD from his place.

tokens.t: Then the spirit took me up, and I heard behind me a voice of a great rushing,
, Blessed
the glory of the
from his place.

verses.plain: I heard also the noise of the wings of the living creatures that touched one another, and the noise of the wheels over against them, and a noise of a great rushing.

tokens.t: also the noise of the wings of the living creatures that touched one another, and the noise of the wheels over against them, and a noise of a great rushing.

verses.plain: So the spirit lifted me up, and took me away, and I went in bitterness, in the heat of my spirit; but the hand of the LORD was strong upon me.

tokens.t: So the spirit lifted me up, and took me away, and I went in bitterness, in the heat of my spirit; but the hand of the
was strong upon me.

verses.plain: ¶ Then I came to them of the captivity at Tel-abib, that dwelt by the river of Chebar, and I sat where they sat, and remained there astonished among them seven days.

tokens.t: ¶ Then I came to them of the captivity at Tel-abib, that dwelt by the river of Chebar, and I sat where they sat, and remained there astonished among them seven days.

verses.plain: And it came to pass at the end of seven days, that the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

tokens.t: And it came to pass at the end of seven days, that the word of the
came unto me, saying,

verses.plain: Son of man, I have made thee a watchman unto the house of Israel: therefore hear the word at my mouth, and give them warning from me.

tokens.t: Son of man, I have made thee a watchman unto the house of Israel: therefore hear the word at my mouth, and give them warning from me.

verses.plain: When I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; and thou givest him not warning, nor speakest to warn the wicked from his wicked way, to save his life; the same wicked man shall die in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at thine hand.

tokens.t: When I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; and thou givest him not warning, nor speakest to warn the wicked from his wicked way, to save his life; the same wicked
shall die in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at thine hand.

verses.plain: Yet if thou warn the wicked, and he turn not from his wickedness, nor from his wicked way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.

tokens.t: Yet if thou warn the wicked, and he turn not from his wickedness, nor from his wicked way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.

verses.plain: Again, When a righteous man doth turn from his righteousness, and commit iniquity, and I lay a stumblingblock before him, he shall die: because thou hast not given him warning, he shall die in his sin, and his righteousness which he hath done shall not be remembered; but his blood will I require at thine hand.

tokens.t: Again, When a righteous

doth turn from his righteousness, and commit iniquity, and I lay a stumblingblock before him, he shall die: because thou hast not given him warning, he shall die in his sin, and his righteousness which he hath done shall not be remembered; but his blood will I require at thine hand.

verses.plain: Nevertheless if thou warn the righteous man, that the righteous sin not, and he doth not sin, he shall surely live, because he is warned; also thou hast delivered thy soul.

tokens.t: Nevertheless if thou warn the righteous
, that the righteous sin not, and he doth not sin, he shall surely live, because he is warned; also thou hast delivered thy soul.

verses.plain: ¶ And the hand of the LORD was there upon me; and he said unto me, Arise, go forth into the plain, and I will there talk with thee.

tokens.t: ¶ And the hand of the
was there upon me; and he said unto me, Arise, go forth into the plain, and I will there talk with thee.

verses.plain: Then I arose, and went forth into the plain: and, behold, the glory of the LORD stood there, as the glory which I saw by the river of Chebar: and I fell on my face.

tokens.t: Then I arose, and went forth into the plain: and, behold, the glory of the
stood there, as the glory which I saw by the river of Chebar: and I fell on my face.

verses.plain: Then the spirit entered into me, and set me upon my feet, and spake with me, and said unto me, Go, shut thyself within thine house.

tokens.t: Then the spirit entered into me, and set me upon my feet, and spake with me, and said unto me, Go, shut thyself within thine house.

verses.plain: But thou, O son of man, behold, they shall put bands upon thee, and shall bind thee with them, and thou shalt not go out among them:

tokens.t: But thou, O son of man, behold, they shall put bands upon thee, and shall bind thee with them, and thou shalt not go out among them:

verses.plain: And I will make thy tongue cleave to the roof of thy mouth, that thou shalt be dumb, and shalt not be to them a reprover: for they are a rebellious house.

tokens.t: And I will make thy tongue cleave to the roof of thy mouth, that thou shalt be dumb, and shalt not be to them a reprover: for they
a rebellious house.

verses.plain: But when I speak with thee, I will open thy mouth, and thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; He that heareth, let him hear; and he that forbeareth, let him forbear: for they are a rebellious house.

tokens.t: But when I speak with thee, I will open thy mouth, and thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord
; He that heareth, let him hear; and he that forbeareth, let him forbear: for they
a rebellious house.

footnotes.text: of a…: Heb. deep of lip, and heavy of tongue
of a…: Heb. deep of lip, and heavy of language
Surely…: or, If I had sent thee, etc. would they not have hearkened unto thee?
impudent…: Heb. stiff of forehead, and hard of heart
a reprover: Heb. a man reproving
